body:
Ok, I think I understand this is related to recent discussions about timing attacks based on early-terminating comparisons. But this code is really awful for performance.

Why not just compare the bytes directly? I don't understand the purpose of unpacking here. Here's a constant-time compare that's not as bad for perf as the old one:

```ruby
def secure_compare3(a, b)
  return false unless a.bytesize == b.bytesize
 
  i = 0
  max = a.bytesize
  ok = true
  while i < max
    ok &&= a.getbyte(i) == b.getbyte(i)
    i+=1
  end
  ok
end
```

My numbers:

